intro: Davya guianensis, commonly known as the Guianan davya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Guyana and Suriname. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shady environments and is often found in lowland forests. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small, smooth seeds.
